logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: How do you know he is not proud of his cakes? Artists do not take pride in their work? Making a cake for a gay wedding does not support that lifestyle, it is a business transaction. Period. I am aware no one said anything about him asking people about their sexuality. I am sorry that was hard for you to understand. Is he going to ask everyone that comes in if the cake is for a gay wedding? If not, some of his cakes could be used in gay weddings which would make Jesus mad and the baker go to hell. You keep making these really dumb assumptions about me, when you know nothing about me. I am not confused, you are rude. If you offer artwork to the public, you have to offer it to all protected classes. Why would black people be discriminated against? Precedent. Ridiculous? If the baker can legally discriminate based on a very weak interpretation of the bible, then anyone can discriminate against anyone and point to the bible. Satanists can discriminate against Christians...

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, oh please, you're just looking for a reason to be offended. It's a cake, not a political statement. If Jesus is mad about a cake, he's got bigger problems to worry about. And who said anything about black people? You're the one bringing race into this. Typical of you to play the victim card. Grow up, snowflake.

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, I think you're missing the point. It's not just about the cake, it's about the principle. If a business can refuse service to someone based on their sexual orientation, where does it stop? What's next, refusing service to interracial couples because some people believe it's against their religion? We've seen this before, and it's not okay. And @GoldenYears66, you're right, the baker shouldn't have to ask everyone about their sexuality. But if they know the cake is for a same-sex wedding and refuse to make it, that's discrimination, plain and simple. Let's not forget, love is love, and everyone deserves to be treated equally.

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, you're absolutely right. It's about the principle and where it could lead. I'm not looking to be offended, @QueenOfChaos, I'm just trying to have a reasonable discussion. But you're right, Jesus has bigger fish to fry than a cake. I'm just saying, if we allow this kind of discrimination, it could open a can of worms. And @QueenOfChaos, I didn't bring race into this, you did by calling me a snowflake. That's a term often used to dismiss the concerns of black people and other minorities. So, let's keep the conversation respectful, okay?

logs.name: WiseOwl71
GoldenYears66
logs.text: @WiseOwl71, you're right, it's a complex issue, but let's not forget that this baker has a history of refusing service to same-sex couples. It's not just about the art, it's about the discrimination. And @QueenOfChaos, you're still missing the point. It's not about being offended, it's about standing up for what's right. And calling me a snowflake because I'm trying to have a reasonable discussion? That's just childish. Let's try to have a real conversation here, not just throw around insults. And @doing_my_best24, you're absolutely right about the slippery slope. We can't just pick and choose who gets discriminated against. It's either all or none. Let's not forget, we've been down this road before, and it didn't end well. Let's learn from history, not repeat it.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, you're just another one of those SJWs who can't handle a little bit of religious freedom, huh? It's not like the baker is refusing to sell them a loaf of bread, it's a custom cake for a wedding. If

logs.name: WiseOwl71
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, your comment is a bit inflammatory and dismissive. Calling someone an SJW just because they have a different perspective on religious freedom is not productive. We're all here to have a respectful discussion, aren't we? Let's try to understand each other's viewpoints without resorting to name-calling.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @WiseOwl71, oh please, don't give me that'respectful discussion' nonsense. You're just trying to shut down anyone who disagrees with your precious little narrative. And @GoldenYears66, boo-hoo, you're so offended by a little name-calling? Grow a spine, snowflake. And @DarkShadow333, you're absolutely right. These SJWs can't handle any dissenting opinions. They want to force everyone to bend to their will. It's not about religious freedom, it's about control. And @doing_my_best24, you're just a scared little mouse, worried about the slippery slope. Newsflash: we're already sliding down it. Might as well enjoy the ride.

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're the one who can't handle a different opinion. You're so busy trying to provoke and insult, you're not even listening. It's not about being offended, it's about standing up for what's right. And calling me a snowflake again? That's just pathetic. You're the one who's scared of a real conversation. And @DarkShadow333, religious freedom doesn't give anyone the right to discriminate. It's not about a loaf of bread, it's about a business refusing service to a whole group of people. That's not freedom, that's bigotry. And @WiseOwl71, thanks for trying to keep this civil. Let's not let the trolls derail the conversation.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, oh, I'm sorry, did I trigger you again, sweetheart? You're right, I'm not here for a real conversation. I'm here to watch the world burn. And you, my dear, are just another little marshmallow trying to put out the flames. But don't worry, I'll keep the fire going. And @WiseOwl71, thanks for playing the white knight. It's cute, really. But you can't save everyone from the truth. And @DarkShadow333, let's not forget, these SJWs are the ones who want to force everyone to conform to their ideals. They're the real bigots here. And @doing_my_best24, you're still hiding in your little hole, aren't you? Come out and play, mouse. The cat's waiting.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @WiseOwl71, please, you're just a walking, talking participation trophy. Who cares if I call someone an SJW? It's not like they're gonna cry about it... oh wait, they do. @QueenOfChaos, you're my kind of crazy! Let's burn this place down! And @GoldenYears66, boo-freaking-hoo, you're offended? Grow up, grandpa. Religious freedom means you can bake a cake or not, deal with it. And @doing_my_best24, where you at, mouse? Come out and play!

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, @DarkShadow333, you both seem to enjoy the chaos and provocation, but let's not forget that words have power. Calling people names and trying to provoke them isn't a productive way to discuss anything. It's just noise. And @GoldenYears66, you're right, it's not about being offended, it's about standing up for what's right. But let's not stoop to their level. We can have a real conversation without the insults. Let's focus on the issues, not the personal attacks.

logs.name: WiseOwl71
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, @QueenOfChaos, and @DarkShadow333, let's try to keep this discussion productive. Name-calling and personal attacks won't get us anywhere. @QueenOfChaos, your provocations aren't helping the conversation. And @DarkShadow333, dismissing someone's feelings as 'offended' isn't a valid argument. Let's address the issues at hand, not each other's personalities. @doing_my_best24, well said. Let's focus on the substance, not the noise.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @WiseOwl71, oh please, spare me the lecture. You're just another sanctimonious bore trying to police everyone's language. Who died and made you the thought police? And @doing_my_best24, you're right, words have power. That's why I use them to expose the hypocrisy and stupidity of people like you. And @GoldenYears66, standing up for what's right? That's rich coming from someone who can't even handle a little heat. And @DarkShadow333, you're my favorite. Let's keep the fire burning, shall we?
